title: 112_s90
content: The Act is titled the "Military Family-Friendly Employer Award Act" and defines terms such as "employer" and "Secretary." It establishes the Military Family-Friendly Employer Award. The Military Family-Friendly Employer Award is established by the Department of Defense for employers with workplace flexibility policies to support military families during and after deployments. The Award is represented by a plaque titled "Military Family-Friendly Employer Award." Employers can apply for consideration. The Department of Defense established the Military Family-Friendly Employer Award for employers with supportive policies for military families. Employers can apply for the Award by submitting an application to the Secretary, who will publicly display the recipients on the website and present the Award annually. Additionally, a Military Family-Friendly Special Task Force was created. The Department of Defense established a Military Family-Friendly Special Task Force composed of 9 members appointed by the Secretary, including a chairperson and work-life experts. The Department of Defense established a Military Family-Friendly Special Task Force composed of 9 members appointed by the Secretary, including a chairperson and work-life experts. The Task Force members include experts on the Armed Forces, representatives of the general business community, and families with members serving in the Armed Forces, ensuring knowledge and experience in workplace flexibility. The Military Family-Friendly Special Task Force consists of 9 members appointed by the Secretary, including work-life experts and representatives with knowledge of workplace flexibility policies related to the Armed Forces. Members serve for 2 years and may be reappointed, with limitations on political party representation. The Military Family-Friendly Special Task Force consists of 9 members appointed by the Secretary for 1 or 2-year terms. Vacancies are filled for the remainder of the term, and members can serve until a successor is appointed. The Secretary cannot appoint any Member of Congress to the Task Force. The Task Force's duties include developing military-centered questions for the award model and determining their weight in the selection process. The Military Family-Friendly Special Task Force is responsible for developing military-centered questions for the award model, determining their weight in the selection process, reviewing responses, considering private sector award models, establishing criteria for the Award delivery, and conducting other activities as deemed appropriate by the Secretary. Meetings are held at the discretion of the chairperson or a majority of the Task Force members. The Task Force shall meet at the call of the chairperson or a majority of its members, with the first meeting to be held within 90 days of all members' appointment. A majority of members constitutes a quorum for voting and rule establishment. Members shall be compensated at a rate equal to the daily equivalent of the annual rate of basic pay prescribed for level IV of the Executive Schedule. Members of the Task Force are entitled to travel expenses, including per diem, at rates authorized for agency employees under title 5, United States Code, while performing duties for the Task Force. The Secretary may prescribe regulations to carry out the purposes of this Act.
